lyrics.text: Lesson 71. A Famous Clock. First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 第71课。一个著名的时钟。首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Has Big Ben ever gone wrong? When you visit London, one of the first things you will see is Big Ben.
lyrics.translation: 大本钟曾经出错过吗？当你访问伦敦时，你首先会看到的其中一样东西就是大本钟。

lyrics.text: The famous clock which can be heard all over the world on the BBC.
lyrics.translation: 这个著名的时钟，全世界都能在BBC上听到。

lyrics.text: If the Houses of Parliament had not been burned down in 1834, the Great Clock would never have been erected.
lyrics.translation: 如果1834年议会大厦没有被烧毁，大本钟就永远不会被建造。

lyrics.text: Big Ben takes its name from Sir Benjamin Hall, who was responsible for the making of the clock when the new Houses of Parliament were being built.
lyrics.translation: 大本钟的名字来源于本杰明·霍尔爵士，他负责在建造新的议会大厦时制造这座钟。

lyrics.text: It is not only of immense size, but is extremely accurate as well.
lyrics.translation: 它不仅体积巨大，而且极其精确。

lyrics.text: The official from Greenwich Observatory has the clock checked twice a day.
lyrics.translation: 格林尼治天文台的官员每天检查两次钟表。

lyrics.text: On the BBC, you can hear the clock when it is actually striking because microphones are connected to the clock tower.
lyrics.translation: 在BBC上，你可以听到大本钟实际敲响的声音，因为麦克风连接到了钟楼上。

lyrics.text: Big Ben has rarely gone wrong. Once, however, it failed to give the correct time.
lyrics.translation: 大本钟很少出错。然而，有一次，它没有给出正确的时间。

lyrics.text: A painter who had been working on the tower hung a pot of paint on one of the hands and slowed it down.
lyrics.translation: 一位一直在塔上工作的画家在一只手上挂了一个油漆罐，让它慢了下来。
